New Records: The Cavs are the sixth team to go 14-0 and first since the Golden State Warriors opened 24-0 in 2015-16.
Cleveland set a franchise record for points in a quarter with 49 in the first.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points
Jarrett Allen added 24 points and Caris LeVert had 22 for the Cavs
Coby White scored 29 and Nikola Vucevic had 25 for the Bulls
LeVert and Mitchell dropped 3-pointers as the Cavs blitzed the Bulls 21-7 the rest of the way.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavs played without starting forward Evan Mobley, who has been battling an illness the past few days.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavs won 144-126, improving to 14-0 with a win over the Chicago Bulls on Friday night in an NBA Cup game.
Cleveland’s 14-game winning streak is the longest in the club’s 55-year existence.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The @cavs are 1 win from tying the 2nd-best start in NBA HISTORY!

At home. On the road. Short-handed. It doesn’t matter. They’re playing with energy and a connectivity that’s only building their confidence and trust in Atkinson, who inherited a great situation and is only making it better.
Others: The Cavs welcome the Hornets on Sunday.
